item.name: Get Network
item.description: Returns the current network parameters

item.name: Get Tip
item.description: Returns the height and ID of the current block

item.name: Get Tip State
item.description: Returns the current consensus state

item.name: Get Consensus Updates
item.description: Returns applied and reverted blocks since the provided index. Chain scanning can be implemented by requesting updates starting at genesis and iterating until the tip matches.

item.name: Get Index
item.description: Returns the chain index at a specified height

item.name: Get Peers
item.description: Returns a list of all connected peers and metadata associated with them

item.name: Get Transactions
item.description: Returns all transactions currently in the transaction pool. Includes transactions not associated with any registered wallet.

item.name: Get Fee
item.description:
Returns the current fee to broadcast a transaction. The fee is the number of Hastings per byte. To calculate how much a transaction will cost to broadcast, take its encoded size and multiply it by the returned value.

Most transactions are less than 1000 bytes. Using 1000 bytes as a constant size will work for most transactions.

responses.name: Invalid Transaction
responses.body: invalid transaction set: transaction txid:8d78070781994c87b210e615d30ed3d53e80b59228fe8e47e749225887d5abbd is invalid: siacoin input 0 spends nonexistent siacoin output scoid:aecf9303448ea20021686e2aadc36a0a8c8a900be27f04e94091c1f2111cbaa0

item.name: transaction
item.description:
Constructs a transaction sending the siacoin and siafunds to the recipients. The UTXOs used to fund the transaction will be locked for further use. If you no longer want to broadcast the transaction, you should call `/release` to release the UTXOs to be used in other transactions.

After construction, the transaction must be signed using the correct private keys before it can be broadcast. Signing is not handled by \`walletd\` for increased security.

The value for the Siacoins is in Hastings (1 SC = 10^24 H)

item.name: V2 Transaction
item.description:
**This endpoint can only be used after the V2 hardfork activates.**

Constructs a V2 transaction sending the siacoin and siafunds to the recipients. The UTXOs used to fund the transaction will be locked for further use. If you no longer want to broadcast the transaction, you should call `/release` to release the UTXOs to be used in other transactions.

After construction, the transaction must be signed using the correct private keys before it can be broadcast. Signing is not handled by \`walletd\` for increased security.

The value for the Siacoins is in Hastings (1 SC = 10^24 H)

item.name: Get Wallets
item.description: Returns a list of all created wallets

item.name: Add Wallet
item.description:
Adds a new wallet for walletd. All fields in the request body are optional and used to add additional metadata to the wallet

Wallet addresses must be added to the wallet to track the balance.

item.name: Delete Wallet
item.description: Removes a wallet from walletd. Addresses that were previously added will continue to be tracked even if they are no longer connected to any wallets.

item.name: Get Wallet Addresses
item.description: Returns a list of addresses associated with the wallet

item.name: Add Wallet Address
item.description:
Adds an address for the wallet to watch. Address is the only required field. The other fields can be used for optional metadata.

\`spendPolicy\` can, optionally, be used to track the public keys associated with an address.

After registering one or more addresses, the blockchain may need to be rescanned using the subscribe endpoint.

item.name: Delete Wallet Address
item.description: Removes an address from a wallet. Disociating any events or UTXOs not referencing another address. The address will continue to be tracked even if not registered to another wallet.

item.name: Get Wallet Events
item.description: Returns all on-chain events that are relevant to the wallet. This includes transactions, contract payouts, miner payouts, Siafund dividends, contract formations, storage proofs, etc.

item.name: Get Unconfirmed Events
item.description: Returns any unconfirmed events relevant to the wallet.

item.name: Get Wallet Siacoin UTXOs
item.description: Returns a paginated list of Siacoin UTXOs. Immature UTXOs are also returned.

item.name: Get Wallet Siafund UTXOs
item.description: Returns a paginated list of Siafund UTXOs. The UTXOs are sorted by value, descending.

item.name: Fund Transaction
item.description: Funds a transaction using UTXOs from the wallet. The UTXOs are locked for future use. If the transaction is not going to be broadcast, call the release endpoint to free the UTXOs. Signatures must be added externally in order to broadcast the transaction.

item.name: Reserve UTXOs
item.description:
Reserves UTXOs preventing them from being used by the fund endpoint. To unlock the UTXOs and allow other transactions to use them, call the release endpoint.

Duration is the time to lock the UTXOs in nanoseconds. If duration is zero, the outputs will be locked for 10 minutes.

item.name: Release UTXOs
item.description: Release unlocks UTXOs so they can be used to fund transactions when calling the fund endpoint.

item.name: Rescan Status
item.description: Gets the status of an in progress rescan. This endpoint will error if the index mode is not "personal."

item.name: Start Rescan
item.description:
Starts a scan to find state from the specified height.

This endpoint should not be used when in "full" mode.

item.name: Get Balance
item.description:
Gets the balance of an individual address.

When index mode is personal, the address must be associated with an existing wallet.

When index mode is full, the balance of any address can be checked.

item.name: Get Unconfirmed Events
item.description: Returns any unconfirmed events for a specific address.

item.name: Get Siacoin UTXOs
item.description: Get any Siacoin UTXOs owned by the address

item.name: Get Event
item.description:
Returns data on a confirmed event

- In "personal" mode, the events must be relevant to an existing wallet.
    
- In "full" mode, any event that occurred on chain can be used.

item.name: Get State
item.description: Gets the current state of the running walletd node
